paper_abstract: Feature weighing methods are commonly used to find the relative significance among a set of features that are effectively used by the retrieval methods to search image sequences efficiently from large databases. As evidenced in the current literature, dynamic textures (image sequences with regular motion patterns) can be effectively modelled by a set of spatial and temporal motion distribution features like motion co-occurrence matrix. The aim of this paper is to develop effective feature weighting and retrieval methods for a set of dynamic textures while characterized by motion co-occurrence matrices.
paper_title: Feature Weighting and Retrieval Methods for Dynamic Texture Motion Features
